output_list.criticism: The mintlvlToken function has an integer overflow where 'totalSupply' is increased unchecked, allowing an attacker to set any value of 'mintedAmount' to the 'totalSupply' of the contract, aka the 'tradeTrap' issue.

The transfer function has an integer overflow where 'balanceOf[msg.sender]' is decreased and 'balanceOf[_to]' is increased unchecked, allowing an attacker to transfer any value of 'amount' to any address.

The transferFrom function has an integer overflow where 'balanceOf[_from]' is decreased and 'balanceOf[_to]' is increased unchecked, allowing an attacker to transfer any value of 'amount' from any address to any address.
The lend function has an integer overflow where 'balanceOf[msg.sender]' is decreased and 'balanceOf[_to]' is increased unchecked, allowing an attacker to lend any value of 'amount' to any address.

The repayLoan function has an integer overflow where 'balanceOf[msg.sender]' is decreased and 'balanceOf[_to]' is increased unchecked, allowing an attacker to repay any value of 'amount' from any address to any address.
The burnlvlToken function has an integer overflow where 'balanceOf[_from]' is decreased and 'totalSupply' is decreased unchecked, allowing an attacker to burn any value of 'amount' from any address.
